topic.title: HP Helion OpenStack® Carrier Grade (Alpha): Create a New Compute Instance

titlealts.searchtitle: HP Helion OpenStack® Carrier Grade (Alpha): Creating Instances

body.p: Compute instances are virtual machines that run inside the cloud.

li.p: Launch the HP Helion OpenStack Helion Dashboard.
Click the Instances link on the Project dashboard Compute panel.
In the Instances screen, for the instance you want to modify, click Launch Instance.
The Launch Instance dialog box opens, with five tabs: Details, Access and Security, Networking, Post Creation, and Advanced Options. By default, Details is the active tab.
On the Details tab, perform the following tasks:

ul.li: From the Availability Zone list, select the AZ this instance will be associated with.
In the Instance Name field, enter the name for the instance.
From the Flavor list select the flavor.
In the Instance Count field, enter the number of instances required.

li.p: From the Instance Boot Source list, select the source to create the image from:

ul.li: Image -- create an image from an existing image
Snapshot -- create an image from an existing snapshot
Volume -- create an image from an existing volume
Image (create new volume) -- create an image from an existing image and create a new volume
Volume snapshot (create new volume) -- create an image from an existing snapshot and create a new volume

li.p: Select the volume, snapshot, or image from the list that appears.
Additonal fields appear for the boot source option that create a new volume. For more information, refer to Managing Block Storage Volumes.
On the Access & Security tab, perform the following tasks:.

ul.li: From the Keypair list, select the keypair to use with the instance. If there is no key pair, click the + button to import a key pair.
Select the security group to use with the instance.

li.p: On the Networking tab, from the Available Networks list, select the required network. The network is displayed in the Selected Networks box.
A default network is always available. You can also create custom networks which will appear in this list.
On the Post-Creation tab, optionally, enter a script to pass user data to the instance at launch time. In the Customization Script Source list, select:

ul.li: Direct Input to create a script to customize your instance after it launches.
File to specify an existing script.

li.p: For more details, refer to the OpenStack documentation, such as Configure instances at boot.
On the Advanced Options tab, optionally, select Configuration Drive to configure OpenStack to write metadata to a special configuration drive that attaches to the instance when it boots.

The instance can mount this drive and read files from it to get information that is normally available through the metadata service. For more information, see the OpenStack document Store metadata on a configuration drive.
Click Launch to launch the instance.
The new instance is listed in the Instances screen.
